text: Peter Wells (23 May 1929 â€“ 5 January 2018) was a British-born New Zealand athlete. He competed in the High Jump at the 1952 and 1956 Summer Olympics. He also represented England at the 1950 Empire Games in Auckland. He represented New Zealand at the 1954 Commonwealth Games in Vancouver. Wells was born at Friern Barnet in North London. He died at Christchurch, New Zealand on 5 January 2018 at the age of 88.Peter Wells ==References== Category:1929 births Category:2018 deaths Category:British athletes Category:New Zealand athletes Category:Olympians for Great Britain Category:High jumpers Category:Sportspeople from London
title: Peter Wells (athlete)
